quest.name: Rich Veins of Hope
journal: The Crystal Exarch has efficiency on his mind.

Desiring to use your time efficiently, the Crystal Exarch suggests splitting up for the tasks to come. While he transports the earthseed to Chai-Nuzz in Amity, he asks that you see your young dwarven companion, Korutt, safely back to Tomra.

Xamott is pleased that young Korutt was of help to you, and informs you that other dwarves have also come forward wishing to aid your cause. To that end, anticipating that you will have need of mining tools to procure the stone for the Talos, they have modified their spare pickaxes for use by bigger folk. Thus generously furnished, you set out to rejoin your comrades at Top Rung.

You arrive at Top Rung to find Alisaie and Alphinaud returned, along with the help they promised. Yet while there is no shortage of willing hands, there is a shortage of pickaxes for them to wield. How very fortunate, then, that you should be carrying a small mountain of the mining tools with you. Equal parts pleased and incredulous, Alisaie bids you distribute them among the gathered helpers.

As you go about doling out the pickaxes, you meet many a familiar face. Though each has walked a different path to reach this point, all are united in their desire to do their part for Norvrandt. With the last of the volunteers equipped and on their way, you turn your steps back to Alisaie.

After thanking you for your efforts, Alisaie declares that she will take her place alongside the soldiers tasked with defending the laborers while they work. There is much and more still to be done, but in such determined company, you cannot help feeling optimistic.

dialogue.name: KORUTT
dialogue.text: I'm glad I could be of help! If you need any more earthseed, just let me know!

dialogue.name: GLAGG
dialogue.text: <snore> <snore>

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Well, my friend, much as I have enjoyed our time together, I think it best we split up, that we might accomplish our tasks more swiftly.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: I shall see the earthseed safely into the hands of Chai-Nuzz.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: While I am thus employed, would you be so good as to deliver Korutt back to Tomra?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: My thanks, Forename. Brief though it was, 'twas an honor to go adventuring with you. I shall see you back in Amity.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Leave the earthseed to me, my friend, and see Korutt safely back to Tomra. While you are there, a word of thanks to Chief Xamott would not go astray.

dialogue.name: KORUTT
dialogue.text: Phew! Not a single brush with death! Thanks for coming back with me!

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: Lali-ho! Glad you're back, and in one piece! How did you fare with the earthseed, then?

dialogue.name: KORUTT
dialogue.text: I got them all they needed! The Exarch's on his way to Amity with it now!

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: Good to hear that young Korutt was of help. As it happens, a few others came forward while you were gone sayin' they wanted to do their bit as well.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: Given that you're buildin' a Talos, we reckoned you'd be needin' some minin' tools. So we went and modified our spare pickaxes for use by bigger folk.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: Here, take these with you. Should be plenty to go 'round.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: From what our scouts tell me, there's a crowd gathered at Top Rung already. Go and see that everyone has a pickaxe to swing, eh?

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: We did the folk of Amity a kind turn in case we needed a kind turn ourselves one day. Can't say as I expected things to turn out like they have, but I don't regret makin' friends!

dialogue.name: KORUTT
dialogue.text: This is just the start! I'm going to go and see what else I can do!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, you are come at a good time.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Alphinaud came and rounded all of us up. It's funny, I used to be afraid of Eulmorans, and yet here we all are...

dialogue.name: EMPLOYEE03287
dialogue.text: No few free citizens wanted to help, but years of leisure meant that most were in no condition to contribute. Instead, they send their fervent hopes for our success.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: As if restoring the Ladder weren't enough of a task, you're trying to build a giant Talos! I love it!

dialogue.name: GRITHIL
dialogue.text: Did you doubt that we'd be back for more? We've got motivation to spare!

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: There I was thinking you lot had come up with the stupidest plan known to man, when I find out you've managed to drag old Chai-Nuzz into it. Once the job's done, I'll have to go and give the lazy sod a good heckling.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: Forename, good to see you again! How have you been keeping?

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: A-A giant Talos? Can such a thing be done...? Oh, be still my beating heart!

dialogue.name: RHONRON
dialogue.text: Worms! Get your worms! They're the best you'll taste this side of the Bright Cliff! Live and juicy or cured and crunchy, there is something for everyone!

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: Alisaie came looking for willing workers...so here I am!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Look, Forename! People from all over have come to help us quarry stone!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: And this isn't even all of them. As we speak, the volunteers Thancred and Ryne recruited are being escorted to the work site─and by both Crystarium and Eulmoran soldiers, no less.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So as you can see, we have plenty of hands. There's just one problem─we don't have enough tools to put in them. We've been desperately trying to round up more, but we haven't had much luck so far.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Pickaxes from the dwarves!? Trust you to have exactly what we need, exactly when we need it!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, what are you waiting for? Go and hand them out to everyone so they can get to work!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Honestly, Forename, you can already slay gods. You could at least have left the uncanny sense of timing for one of us. It's greedy is what it is.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: We're ready to do our bit, Forename! We just, er...need tools to do it with.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Pickaxes! Loads of 'em!

dialogue.name: EMPLOYEE03287
dialogue.text: Now we may all work to our hearts' content!

dialogue.name: EMPLOYEE03287
dialogue.text: While I don't have many talents, I do have a strong back. And what strength I have, I'll gladly use for the sake of peace.

dialogue.name: IRVITHE
dialogue.text: We got the Ladder moving again, didn't we? If we join hands, there's no Talos we can't build!

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: I still haven't repaid you and Alphinaud for saving me, and I'm not sure I ever could.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: But that ain't going to stop me trying! I'm with you to the end!

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Come on, you lot! Look lively!

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: We've come, Forename. In case you're wondering, Guthjon is here too.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Couldn't wait to start breaking rocks, though, so he's gone on ahead. Bah, he could've at least left us a spare set of tools...

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Ah, wonderful! Now we can be about it too!

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Quarrying isn't exactly my stock-in-trade, but this time...this time I feel as though my wife will be with me, guiding my hand...

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: So let's make it happen. Let's build a world where everyone can live without fear. Where everyone has a place they can go home to.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text:
Right, then, let's be on our way.
...Hm? What are you still doing here, Thaffe? I thought you'd brought your own tools.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: I did. And I was just about to head off, when I saw Jeryk...

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Oh gods, oh gods... If this plan works and the giant Talos comes to life...

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Just imagine the size of the trolley it could push! Imagine it!

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: <sigh> Are you still raving on about that? How many times do I have to tell you, that's not what the Talos is for! Where the hells would the tracks even go?

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: There's bound to be somewhere! You just need a little imagination! Seeing as the Stoneworks is involved, maybe we could have a trolley added to the design...

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Enough! We're going to work! And if I hear any more about trolleys from you, I'll have you pushing one yourself!

dialogue.name: RHONRON
dialogue.text: Long time no see, traveler! Are you waiting to be issued a pickaxe too?

dialogue.name: RHONRON
dialogue.text: Oho, you clearly weren't, and now neither are we! Rest assured, we will put these to good use and work very, very hard!

dialogue.name: RHONRON
dialogue.text: Of course, one cannot work on an empty stomach─which is why I brought some tasty worms to share!

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: Er, as much as we would all enjoy a treat, perhaps the worms are best saved for...afterwards?

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. You may not remember me, but I'm one of the carers from the Inn at Journey's Head.

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: After night returned to Amh Araeng, we noticed a change in our patients. The transformation had halted in every one of them.

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: I can't express what it did to the mood of the place. We were still celebrating, days later, when who should come along but Alisaie. She said that she sought the aid of those who believed in the Warrior of Darkness.

dialogue.name: JOURNEYSHEADNURSE
dialogue.text: We all answered her call right there and then. Of course, some few carers had to remain behind, but as many of us came as could be spared.

dialogue.name: RHONRON
dialogue.text: I too have great respect for the Warrior of Darkness! When we meet, I'll be sure to treat them to a nice, plump worm!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Everything appears to be in order here. In all my time in this world, I do not recall seeing so many optimistic faces.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: My thanks, Forename. With that, everyone is now equipped to work.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I think I'll go and join the soldiers standing guard over the volunteers. It would be a shame if they fell prey to sin eaters after all the trouble we've gone to.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Right! Let us see that this plan is a resounding success─for the sake of all in Norvrandt!
